summary: This document is an email summarizing a call with Dr. Rocchio on October 25, 2021, discussing the concept of 'grooming the environment' in the context of child sexual abuse, drawing parallels to cases like the Boy Scouts. It appears to be part of legal or investigative preparation, likely for the Epstein case, and is subject to a protective order.

persons.name: Dr. Rocchio
persons.context: Participated in a call to discuss concepts of grooming, particularly 'grooming the environment,' and provided insights from forensic and clinical practice regarding child sexual abuse patterns.

events.title: Call with Dr. Rocchio
events.description: A call was held with Dr. Rocchio to discuss the concept of 'grooming the environment' in child sexual abuse cases, including parallels to abuse in organizations like the Boy Scouts.

keyFacts: Dr. Rocchio, an expert, discussed the concept of 'grooming the environment,' where perpetrators position themselves to have ready access to victims and reduce hesitancy.
The discussion included parallels to abuse cases in the Boy Scouts, where a primary perpetrator might use other victims to procure or befriend additional children.
The document is subject to a protective order covering specific paragraphs, indicating its sensitive nature in a legal or investigative context.
The email was sent within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS), suggesting it is part of official case preparation.
